ygData.subject: Re: Bannable Offenses?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It could be,  but not in this case.  I tried to buy a pie sketch and it cost me 1100cp to do so.  So I just sold the ones I had stored up. The profit from
ygData.messageBody:
> Verant specifically lists buying an item from a
> vendor and selling it back at a higher price as
> a bannable offense. I didn't want to take the
> chance.


It could be, but not in this case. I tried to buy a pie sketch and it
cost me 1100cp to do so. So I just sold the ones I had stored up.

The profit from doing this is not bannable BECAUSE they cannot trace
exactly when you purchased the sketch.

Second they made the pricing change, well warned of the consequences
yet the anti-player bigots at Verant went ahead anyway with their price
change (if they wanted to do it right - nerf the resale price of tins)

Ban me? Quiting is a more likely end result for me, after all I had
only about 30 minutes during weekdays to play EQ and pottery/smithing
were a good waste for those 30 minutes.
